item.title: Training
item.description: On Physical Fitness I was never an athletic individual. From childhood, I was never pushed to play sports, train, or do a lot of physical activities. Even playing around on the playground was a rare moment of bliss. Instead, I spent my days staring at a screen, playing Maplestory, O2Jam, Dungeon Siege and various other computer games, which probably contributed to my disastrous eyesight. All this time I wondered if people are just genetically predisposed to either be athletic or not.

item.title: Tranquility
item.description: Utter torment awaits those who seek mercy at the end of a grueling path. Face thine fate with head held high, chest puffed out, and a mind of sacrifice. Noad

item.title: Another Year
item.description: Days pass by like flowing water. The year is ending. Time flows like an unstoppable river, crushing everything within its way until it reaches the ocean. I am 23 years old. The average life expectancy for a male in my demographic is around 72 years old. Without realizing it, I am nearly halfway there. Halfway to an ending. My own father met death at the ripe age of 59. Perhaps I too might only be able to make it to that age.
